cont.entity_a: Becoming a 'standard' lens for the user.
cont.entity_b: Heavy compared to standard zoom lenses.

cont.entity_a: Not supported on the Nikon d5600, requiring manual focus. Does not autofocus on entry-level bodies, requiring manual focus. The lens is noisy when focusing.
Performs better on crop sensor cameras, offering better quality and clarity.
cont.entity_b: Good value for money with excellent image quality.
Beautiful bokeh and is excellent for portraits.

cont.entity_a: Built like a tank. Lightweight due to plastic construction but feels fragile if dropped.
cont.entity_b: Heavy compared to standard zoom lenses.

Light Performance.comm: Excellent for low light photography with the f/1.8 aperture.

cont.entity_b: Fast autofocus and works well in low light conditions. No image stabilization, but the f/1.8 aperture compensates.
Highly recommended for portrait photography due to sharpness and bokeh. Great for portraits and sports photography with fast-moving subjects.

cont.entity_a: Minor sun flares occur when shooting around sunrise or sunset.
cont.entity_b: Some chromatic aberration or color fringing present.
